DT Article
TI On the presence of Notodiaphana atlantica Ortea, Moro et Espinosa, 2013
   in the Mediterranen Sea, with notes on Retusa multiquadrata Oberling,
   1970 and Cylichna mongii (Audouin, 1826) (Cephalaspidea Cylichnidae).
AU Micali, Pasquale (lino.micali@virgilio.it) 
SO Biodiversity Journal
VL 5
IS 4
PS 499-504
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Notodiaphana atlantica Ortea, Moro et Espinosa, 2013 (Cephalaspidea
   Cylichnidae) is reported from various localities of Western and Central
   Mediterranean. Records of Retusa multiquadrata Oberling, 1970 are listed
   and discussed, most of them are considered to be based on N. atlantica.
   Possible synonymy between N. atlantica and R. multiquadrata is
   discussed, but former name is preferred. Based on the study of material
   from Suez channel, Bulla mongii Audouin, 1826 seems to be based on a
   very young specimen of the common species Liloa curia (A. Adams in
   Sowerby, 1850), but as Audouin's name is older, then Bulla curia shall
   be considered synonym of Bulla mongii. Liloa mongii (Audouin, 1826) new
   combination is than proposed.
C1 Micali, Pasquale; Via Papiria 17, Fano, Pesaro Urbino, I-61032, Italy,
   Italy.
EM lino.micali@virgilio.it
SC Zoology
SN 2039-0394; 2039-0408
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; Combination; Synonymy; Available name;
   Taxonomy; Taxonomic position; Marine zones; Atlantic Ocean; North
   Atlantic
DE Notodiaphana atlantica [Mediterranean Sea /  / New record]. 
TN Invertebrates; Molluscs
ST Animalia, Mollusca, Gastropoda, Opisthobranchia, Cephalaspidea

DT Article
TI A New Toadfish Species from Somalia (Teleostei: Batrachoididae).
AU Greenfield, David W. (greenfie@hawaii.edu) 
SO Copeia
VL 4
PS 668-672
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 8
AB The second known species in Barchatus is described from Somalia, in the
   Gulf of Aden. Compared to the other known species, B. cirrhosus from the
   Red Sea, B. indicus has two tentacles above the eye, whereas B.
   cirrhosus only has one large tentacle, and the anterior nares with long
   and pointed tentacles (distal 70% narrow; shorter and wider (distal 35%
   narrow) in B. cirrhosus). Barchatus indicus is only known from the Gulf
   of Aden, Somalia.

AN ZOOR15104024213
DT Article
TI A Remarkable Sexually Dimorphic New Genus and Species of Neoplecostomine
   Catfish (Siluriformes, Loricariidae) from a Coastal Drainage of Eastern
   Brazil.
AU Pereira, Edson H.L.
   Zanata, Angela
   Cetra, Mauricio
   Reis, Roberto E. (ehlpereira@gmail.com) 
SO Copeia
VL 4
PS 673-681
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 11
AB A new neoplecostomine genus and species is described from headwater
   tributaries of the lower Rio Pardo basin, a coastal drainage in Bahia,
   eastern Brazil. Hirtella carinata is a small loricariid with a maximum
   standard length barely reaching 50 mm. The new genus and species are
   diagnosed among all other loricariids by a unique, remarkable pattern of
   sexual dimorphism in which adult males have five conspicuous
   longitudinal rows of bristle-like hypertrophied odontodes on the head
   and along the lateral dermal plates of the body. Hirtella is further
   distinguished from most loricariids by the anterior position of the
   pelvic fin, which originates in a vertical anterior to the nuchal plate,
   and by the possession of an elongate keel formed by 15-17 azygous plates
   along the mid-dorsal line between the dorsal and the caudal fins.
   Hirtella is additionally distinguished from other members of the
   Neoplecostominae by having a medium sized palatine splint, never
   reaching the anterior border of the nasal fossa. Phylogenetic analysis
   indicates that Hirtella is the sister taxon of Pareiorhina. The
   description of this new genus raises to six the number of currently
   recognized genera in the Neoplecostominae.
C1 Reis, Roberto E.; PUCRS, Fac Biociencias, Av Ipiranga,6681,Caixa Postal
   1429, Porto Alegre, RS, BR-90619900 BC, Brazil, Brazil.
EM ehlpereira@gmail.com
RI Pereira, Edson H. L./F-2814-2018; Reis, Roberto/A-7030-2012
OI Reis, Roberto/0000-0003-3746-6894
SC Zoology
SN 0045-8511
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Neotropical region;
   South America
DE Hirtella carinata [Brazil /  / New species]. 
TN Chordates; Fish; Vertebrates

   species Hirtella carinata, p. 674]. 
   Hirtella carinata (Loricariidae): [Sp nov, Brazil, P. 674].

DT Article
TI A new species of Ctenothrips Franklin, 1907 (Thysanoptera: Thripidae)
   from China.
AU Hu Qingling
   Feng Jinian (jinianf@nwsuaf.edu.cn) 
SO Entomotaxonomia
VL 36
IS 4
PS 261-266
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Ctenothrips dissimilis sp. nov. is described and illustrated in detail.
   This new species can be readily distinguished by its 7-segmented
   antennae and inconspicuous reticulations on the abdominal segments. The
   male of this species is very similar to C. niger which has short rounded
   pore plates on sternites III and IV, but can be distinguished from the
   latter by the elongate elliptical pore plates. The number and the color
   pattern of antennal segments are also different. Type specimens are
   deposited in the Entomological Museum of Northwest A&F University
   (NWAFU).
C1 Feng Jinian; Minist Educ, Key Lab Plant Protect Resources & Pest
   Management, Yangling, Shaanxi, 712100, China, China.

   time, of which the genus Ereis Pascoe, 1865 is the first record from

   Golsinda basicornis and the lectotype and paralectotypes of G basicornis
   are designated.

   brevissimus sp. nov., based on a male from Gutian Mountain in Zhejiang
   Province is described and illustrated. This new species is characterized

   description of a new species from China.

LA English
U1 0
U2 1

   zhongtiaoshanensis sp. nov. The new species is similar to Didea fasciata

PT J
AN ZOOR15104023249
PM 25039004
DT Article
TI Multivariate discrimination among cryptic mites of the genus
   Androlaelaps (Acari: Mesostigmata: Laelapidae) parasitic of sympatric
   akodontine rodents (Cricetidae: Sigmodontinae) in northeastern
   Argentina: possible evidence of host switch followed by speciation, with
   the description of two new species.
AU Lareschi, Marcela (mlareschi@yahoo.com.ar) 
   Galliari, Carlos
SO Experimental and Applied Acarology
VL 64
IS 4
PS 479-499
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 15
AB Laelapids are among the most common ectoparasites of rodents. Currently,
   it is under discussion whether there is a single polixenous species that
   parasites a variety of hosts, or whether there are cryptic species
   highly host specific. Herein, multivariate morphometric analyses of
   cryptic sympatric laelapids of the genus Androlaelaps allowed us to
   identify different species. These species are specific of their
   akodontine hosts, Akodon montensis and Thaptomys nigrita, in localities
   situated in northeastern Argentina. In addition, we analyzed similar
   laelapids associated with the akodontines Deltamys kempi and Akodon
   cursor. Using principle component analyses we differentiated four
   laelapid species, each one host specific, independent of sympatry of the
   hosts, and without geographical variation. From these four species, we
   described two new species (Androlaelaps navonae n.sp. and Androlaelaps
   wingei n.sp.). We determined the four species based on a range of
   variations in several characters, mainly size. These four laelapid
   species belong to the Androlaelaps rotundus species group, specific to
   akodontines. These species are very similar among them but differ from
   the remainder species of the group by their small size, distance between
   j6 setae similar to the distance between the z5 setae, strong ventral
   setae, opisthogaster with 13 pairs of strong setae (one close to the
   distal margin of epigynal shield), and anal shield wider than long.
   Further studies will elucidate whether they constitute a new laelapid
   genus. Phylogenetic and ecological factors influencing host-specificity
   are discussed, and we propose that host colonization could have taken
   place by host switching of a single laelapid species among rodent
   species, followed by speciation.
C1 Lareschi, Marcela; CONICET UNLP, Ctr Estudios Parasitol & Vectores
   CEPAVE, Bulevar 120 E-Av 60 & Calle 64,B1902CHX, La Plata, Buenos Aires,
   Argentina, Argentina.
EM mlareschi@yahoo.com.ar
SC Parasitology; Zoology; Anatomy &Morphology; Evolutionary Biology
SN 0168-8162
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Biometrics; Evolution; Parasites
   diseases and disorders; Parasites; Hosts; Land zones; Neotropical
   region; South America
DE Akodon cursor [Arachnid parasites / Androlaelaps rotundus species group
   / Host specificity; host switching; speciation; systematics] [ /
   Androlaelaps wingei / New parasite species] [Argentina / Misiones / ]
   [Brazil /  / New arachnid parasite species]. 
   Akodon montensis; Deltamys kempi [Arachnid parasites / Androlaelaps
   rotundus species group / Host specificity; host switching; speciation;
   systematics] [Argentina / Misiones / ]. 
   Androlaelaps navonae [Mammalian hosts / Thaptomys nigrita / New parasite
   species] [Argentina /  / New species from mammalian host]. 
   Androlaelaps rotundus species group [Biometrics / Morphometrics / host
   specificity; host switching; systematics] [Speciation /  / ] [Mammalian
   hosts / Akodon cursor / ] [ / Akodon montensis / ] [ / Deltamys kempi /
   ] [ / Thaptomys nigrita / ] [Argentina / Misiones / ]. 
   Androlaelaps wingei [Mammalian hosts / Akodon cursor / New parasite
   species] [Brazil /  / New species from mammalian host]. 
   Thaptomys nigrita [Arachnid parasites / Androlaelaps navonae / New
   parasite species] [ / Androlaelaps rotundus species group / Host
   specificity; host switching; speciation; systematics] [Argentina /  /
   New arachnid parasite species] [ / Misiones / ]. 
TN Arachnids; Arthropods; Chelicerates; Chordates; Invertebrates; Mammals;
   Rodents; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Arachnida, Acari, Chordata, Vertebrata, Mammalia,
   Rodentia, Muridae

PT J
AN ZOOR15104026832
DT Article
TI DESCRIPTION OF THE SECOND LAOTIA SAURIN, 1953; A GENUS NEW TO THE FAUNA
   OF VIETNAM (GASTROPODA: CYCLOPHOROIDEA).
AU Pall-Gergely, Barna (pallgergely2@gmail.com) 
SO Folia Malacologica
VL 22
IS 4
PS 289-292
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB This paper reports the second species of the genus Laotia Saurin, 1953.
   L. pahiensis Saurin, 1953 was described from Laos, Pa Hia, whereas the
   new species, L. christahemmenae n. sp. was collected in Ha Noi Province,
   Vietnam, approximately 350 km NE of the type localty of the Laotian
   species. The new species is approximately twice larger than its
   congener, and has a ribbed shell with a smooth area behind its aperture.
   In contrast, L. pahiensis is ribbed until the peristome or the ribbing
   stops very close to the peristome. It is uncertain if Laotia should be
   placed in Diplommatinidae or in Alycaeidae.
C1 Pall-Gergely, Barna; Shinshu Univ, Dept Biol, Matsumoto, Nagano,
   3908621, Japan, Japan.
EM pallgergely2@gmail.com
SC Zoology
SN 1506-7629
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Land zones; Oriental
   region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Laotia [Vietnam /  / New record; systematics]. 
   Laotia christahemmenae [Vietnam /  / New species]. 
TN Invertebrates; Molluscs
ST Animalia, Mollusca, Gastropoda, Prosobranchia, Mesogastropoda,
   Cyclophoroidea
OR Laotia - Saurin 1953 (Cyclophoroidea): [Taxonomic position, P. 289; New
   record]. 
   Laotia christahemmenae (Cyclophoroidea): [Sp nov, Vietnam, P. 291].

PT J
AN ZOOR15104025689
DT Article
TI Chauliocheilos saxatilis, a new genus and species of Hypoptopomatinae
   from rio Jequitinhonha basin, with a unique labial appendix (Teleostei:
   Loricariidae).
AU Martins, Fernanda O. (fernanda_martins2@hotmail.com) 
   Andrade, Breno N.
   Rosa, Alaina C.
   Langeani, Francisco
SO Ichthyological Exploration of Freshwaters
VL 25
IS 3
PS 193-204
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB Chauliocheilos saxatilis, new genus and species, is described from
   headwater streams of the rio Itamarandiba, upper rio Jequitinhonha
   basin, southeastern Brazil. The new genus is diagnosed from all other
   Loricariidae members by having a unique labial appendix at laterodorsal
   portion of lower lip, associated to the proximal region of insertion of
   the maxillary barbel. From all Hypoptopomatinae genera, Chauliocheilos
   can be distinguished by having two additional series of lateral plates,
   one between the dorsal and mid-dorsal series, and the other between the
   mid-ventral and ventral series. In addition, the great number of lateral
   plates, the absence of the iris operculum, and the posterior dorsal-fin
   insertion contacting the neural spine of eighth vertebra, are other
   useful features to recognize the genus. The phylogenetic position of
   Chauliocheilos among the Hypoptopomatinae, as well as the morphology and
   possible functions of the labial appendix, are discussed.
C1 Martins, Fernanda O.; UNESP Univ Estadual Paulista, Inst Biociencias
   Letras & Ciencias Exatas, Rua Cristovao Colombo 2265, Sao Jose Do Rio
   Preto, SP, BR-15054000 BC, Brazil, Brazil.
EM fernanda_martins2@hotmail.com
RI Martins, Fernanda O/J-9396-2014; Langeani, Francisco/B-7880-2012
OI Langeani, Francisco/0000-0001-7376-4798
SC Zoology
SN 0936-9902
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Land zones; Neotropical region;
   South America
DE Chauliocheilos saxatilis [Brazil /  / New species].

   Siluriformes, Loricariidae

   Type species Chauliocheilos saxatilis, p. 194]. 
   Chauliocheilos saxatilis (Loricariidae): [Sp nov, Brazil, P. 195].

DT Article
TI Schistura mizoramensis, a new species of loach from Mizoram,
   northeastern India (Teleostei: Nemacheilidae).
AU Lalramliana (lrl_zoo@yahoo.co.in) 
   Lalronunga, Samuel
   Vanramliana
   Lalthanzara, Hmar
SO Ichthyological Exploration of Freshwaters
VL 25
IS 3
PS 205-212
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 0
AB Schistura mizoramensis, new species, is described from Tuirivang River,
   a tributary of Tuirial River (Barak drainage) in Mizoram, northeastern
   India. It is distinguished from its congeners in having a unique colour
   pattern with a prominent dark brown longitudinal stripe along midlateral
   line from upper edge of gill opening to middle of caudal-fin base; a
   dark brown stripe on the dorsal midline from dorsal-fin origin to dorsal
   part of caudal-fin base; network of bars which reduce the light
   yellowish ground color to isolated spots on the flanks and predorsal
   region of dorsum. It is further distinguished from its congeners in
   having the combination of characters: 9 + 8 branched caudal-fin rays,
   complete lateral line and absence of suborbital flap in males.
C1 Lalramliana; Pachhunga Univ Coll, Dept Zool, Aizawl Mizoram, 796001,
   India, India.
EM lrl_zoo@yahoo.co.in

AN ZOOR15104025691
DT Article
TI Microlepidogaster discontenta, a new species of hypoptopomatine catfish
   (Teleostei: Loricariidae) from the rio Sao Francisco basin, Brazil.
AU Calegari, Barbara B. (barbara.calegari@gmail.com) 
   Silva, Ellen V.
   Reis, Roberto E.
SO Ichthyological Exploration of Freshwaters
VL 25
IS 3
PS 213-221
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 4
AB Microlepidogaster discontenta, new species, is described from a creek
   tributary to the upper rio Sao Francisco basin, central Brazil, and
   constitutes the first record of the genus in that basin. It is
   distinguished from all congeners mainly by the odontodes on the caudal
   peduncle being conspicuously arranged in longitudinal lines (vs.
   odontodes on the caudal peduncle not arranged in longitudinal lines);
   and shorter pectoral-pelvic fins distance. Additionally, the new species
   differs from all congeners except M. longicolla by having a wide naked
   area on the snout tip (vs. an inconspicuous naked area or a rostral
   plate). Microlepidogaster discontenta is further distinguished from its
   congeners by a series of proportional measurements of the body and
   osteological features.
C1 Calegari, Barbara B.; Pontificia Univ Catolica Rio Grande Sul, Lab
   Sistemat Vertebrados, Av Ipiranga 6681,Caixa Postal 1429, Porto Alegre,
   RS, BR-90619900 BC, Brazil, Brazil.
EM barbara.calegari@gmail.com
RI Calegari, Barbara/F-2348-2018; Reis, Roberto/A-7030-2012
OI Calegari, Barbara/0000-0001-6335-6854; Reis, Roberto/0000-0003-3746-6894
SC Zoology
SN 0936-9902

   Neotropical region; South America

   Microlepidogaster discontenta [Brazil /  / New species].

   species, P. 220; New record]. 
   Microlepidogaster discontenta (Loricariidae): [Sp nov, Brazil, P. 214].

PT J
AN ZOOR15104025692
DT Article
TI Garra jordanica, a new species from the Dead Sea basin with remarks on
   the relationship of G. ghorensis, G. tibanica and G. rufa (Teleostei:
   Cyprinidae).
AU Hamidan, Nashat A.
   Geiger, Matthias F.
   Freyhof, Joerg (nashat.hamidan@rscn.org.jo) 
SO Ichthyological Exploration of Freshwaters
VL 25
IS 3
PS 223-236
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 3
AB Germ jordanica, new species, is described from the northern Dead Sea
   basin in Jordan and Syria. It is related to G. ghorensis from the
   southern Dead Sea basin from which it is distinguished by having 8 1/2
   branched dorsal-fin rays; 33-35+2 lateral line scales; 5-7 scales
   between the pelvic-fin base and the anus; a large round, black blotch on
   the flank at the middle of the posterior extremity of the caudal
   peduncle; the pelvic fin not overlapping the anus in individuals larger
   than 70 mm SL; shorter barbels; and details in the arrangement of
   tubercles on the head. Garra jordanica also differs from G. ghorensis by
   a nearest neighbor distance of 4.1 % K2P in its COI barcode region. It
   had previously been postulated that G. ghorensis from southern Jordan
   has a close relationship to G. tibanica or to G. rufa. Of the two
   contradicting hypotheses our results support a closer relationship of G.
   ghorensis to G. rufa.
C1 Freyhof, Joerg; German Ctr Integrat Biodivers Res iDiv Halle Jena,
   Deutsch Pl 5a, Leipzig, D-04103, Germany, Germany.
EM nashat.hamidan@rscn.org.jo
RI Geiger, Matthias/S-3459-2017
OI Geiger, Matthias/0000-0003-2403-0805
SC Zoology; Genetics &Heredity; Evolutionary Biology
SN 0936-9902
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Genetics; Evolution; Land zones;
   Palaearctic region; Eurasia; Asia
DE Garra ghorensis; Garra rufa; Garra tibanica [Molecular genetics / COI
   barcode region / ] [Phylogeny / Phylogenetic relationships / ]. 
   Garra jordanica [Jordan /  / New species] [Syria /  / ]. 
TN Chordates; Fish; Vertebrates
ST Animalia, Chordata, Vertebrata, Pisces, Osteichthyes, Actinopterygii,
   Cypriniformes, Cyprinidae
OR Garra ghorensis (Cyprinidae). 
   Garra jordanica (Cyprinidae): [Sp nov, Jordan, P. 227]. 
   Garra rufa (Cyprinidae). 
   Garra tibanica (Cyprinidae). 
UT ZOOREC:ZOOR15104025692
DA 2020-09-17

DT Article
TI Paracobitis atrakensis, a new species of crested loach from northeastern
   Iran (Teleostei: Nemacheilidae).
AU Esmaeili, Hamid Reza
   Mousavi-Sabet, Hamed
   Sayyadzadeh, Golnaz
   Vatandoust, Saber
   Freyhof, Joerg (hresmaeili22@gmail.com) 
SO Ichthyological Exploration of Freshwaters
VL 25
IS 3
PS 237-242
PD Dec 2014
PY 2014
LA English
U1 0
U2 1
AB Paracobitis atrakensis, new species, from the Atrak and Bidvaz River
   drainages in northeastern Iran, is distinguished from other species in
   the genus occurring in the Middle East by the combination of having a
   truncate or slightly emarginated caudal fin and no scales on the body,
   except for few scales on the dorsal adipose crest in some individuals.
